newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: KL TIN PRICE FALLS ON LME AS RINGGIT GOES YO-YO.
newsitem.headline: KL TIN PRICE FALLS ON LME AS RINGGIT GOES YO-YO.

text.p: Malaysia's spot tin price fell 12 cents to 14.55 ringgit ($5.24) a kg on Thursday in tandem with an overnight fall on the London Metal Exchange (LME), traders said.
They said the wild fluctuation of the ringgit had also sidelined more buyers from coming into the market.
Despite the corection, dealers said there were still prospects for the price to touch 15 ringgit a kg.
"The ringgit is going yo-yo and it's difficult for people to read the trend," said a trader. "If the LME firms up over the next week, we might still hit 15 ringgit (for the spot price).
At the opening, there were sales offers for 144 tonnes against bids for 83.
Final turnover was 118 tonnes, from 135 on Wednesday, and was absorbed by European, Japanese and local interests.
Traders said the current price against the LME was trading at a discount of $10 against $20 premium on Wednesday.
